intro: Moschosma caesium, commonly known as the golden lily, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking golden-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to cold, dry environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its stems are erect and can reach heights of up to two meters. Moschosma caesium is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
